results.title: The Team with Manchester United
results.creator_credit: Ray Marshall, Terry Ryan, HTV and Opix Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on soccer”
Sir Matt Busby, soccer’s most famous club manager describes with the help of the present Manchester United team, the essential elements of teamwork. Shows various tactical approaches and gives advice on building a balanced team.

results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and Bruce Allen
results.brief_description: Would-be-pilots and student pilots are given some idea of the training principles and techniques used in flying today’s modern aircraft, such as Hercules, mirages and helicopters

results.title: The Teaching triad (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: AIMS Instructional Media, Dubnoff Center, Jerry Maybrook, Susan Rafin and Lane Wipff
results.brief_description: Focuses on the direct involvement of the educational therapist with the family of the handicapped child as well as the child himself. Defines the teacher parent child component as the teaching triad and demonstrates ways teachers and parents together can help to bring the child to his optimal level of development.
results.creator_credit_for_label: AIMS Instructional Media, Dubnoff Center, Jerry Maybrook, Susan Rafin and Lane Wipff

results.title: The Teaching box
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and Stephen Ocko
results.brief_description: Describes the establishment of a revolutionary experiment in education which has been successfully launched in American Samoa - a group of six small islands. Seeking an expansion of their educational system, Samoans turned to closed circuit television for a solution. High quality education on both primary and secondary school levels is now transmitted daily throughout the islands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Agency and Stephen Ocko

results.title: The Teachers
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, David Haythornthwaite and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Let’s Talk about It”.
Provides comments from the two teachers involved in the sex education program “Let’s Talk About It”. Includes clips from the series and discussions of the problems and rewards of teaching sex education.

results.title: The Teacher: authority or automaton?
results.creator_credit: Richard Gilbert, ONF | NFB and Mort Ransen
results.brief_description: In our overflowing classrooms, are methods of mass production edging out traditional ways of education? This film offers a vocal sampling of opinion from across Canada. Teachers, administrators and high-ranking educators speak their minds freely about the problems facing education in Canada today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Gilbert, ONF | NFB and Mort Ransen

results.title: The Teacher and Technology (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Use of audiovisual equipment in the classroom. The technical sophistication is not as important as the usage and the input. Stresses need for careful selection of media to suit specific learning experience and students involved

results.title: The Taxi driver
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Louis Portugais and Jean Roy
results.brief_description: Accompanies Gerry Lane, a taxi driver, on a few rides and presents a sampling of the parade of people, of all types and temperaments, that pass in and out of his cab in endless procession, all with very personal concerns but all with one thing in common - a desire to get somewhere in a hurry.

results.title: The Tasmanian tiger
results.creator_credit: Linda Taylor, Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Two tourists in search of Tasmania’s Thylacine or marsupial tiger, now probably extinct, see most of the island’s native animals in a zoo. Contains rare archival footage of a Tasmanian tiger in captivity and extensive footage of the Tasmanian devil.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linda Taylor, Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production and Don Anderson
results.description: Two tourists in search of Tasmania’s Thylacine or marsupial tiger, now probably extinct, see most of the island’s native animals in a zoo. Contains rare archival footage of a Tasmanian tiger in captivity and extensive footage of the Tasmanian devil.
